results.title: Toy lantern slides
results.credit_line: ACMI Collection. Donated by William Kerr on behalf of Edwin Schefferle.
results.brief_description: There are six parts to the butterflies slides, each slide has 4 images. These small slides have red sealing tape around the edges. These slides form part of The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit with removable chimney and internal wooden block. The lantern is housed in original box with metal handle, and internal red and blue graphic for: The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit. 20 glass slides in custom box, length of textile to keep box shut, 2 small empty boxes which act to store slides in a snug manner.

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Miss Greek Charity Quest]
results.brief_description:
This silent film shows people at the Athenaeum Club in Melbourne celebrating the New Year and finalists of the Miss Greek Charity Quest.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Preparations for Miss Greek Charity Quest]
results.brief_description:
This film shows a small fundraiser and social occasion with Greek youth holding a raffle, barbecue and dance. Money raised supported the Miss Greek Charity Quest, for which the preparations can be seen.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Greek Boy Scouts and Girl Guides supporting Bishop at Festival Hall]
results.brief_description:
This silent film shows the Greek Boy Scouts and other children assembling to celebrate National Day of the Greek Community, 25th March 1966 at Festival Hall, Melbourne.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: [John Robertson Duigan Film Collection: Reel 14]
results.brief_description:
The John Robertson Duigan Collection is a collection of silent 9.5mm home movies filmed by early aviator and engineer John Robertson Duigan (1882–1951). The collection includes a Pathé-Baby 9.5mm film camera and projector owned by Duigan. The home movies provide an insight into the everyday lives of John and his family in Victoria, including picnics, trips to the Grampians and Colac, family snapshots and aeroplanes of the late 1920s.

This short film, originally shot on 9.5mm film, shows a group of film competing in a wheelbarrow race (one person holding another’s ankles while they walk with their hands); running; collecting water in a pail; playing with dogs; rowing on a river or lake; and picnicking and lounging on the grass with 1920s cars behind. The film then shows people on a golfcourse and three women and a dog in the gardens of a large home.

results.title: [John Robertson Duigan Film Collection: Reel 13]
results.brief_description:
The John Robertson Duigan Collection is a collection of silent 9.5mm home movies filmed by early aviator and engineer John Robertson Duigan (1882–1951). The collection includes a Pathé-Baby 9.5mm film camera and projector owned by Duigan. The home movies provide an insight into the everyday lives of John and his family in Victoria, including picnics, trips to the Grampians and Colac, family snapshots and aeroplanes of the late 1920s.

This short film, originally shot on 9.5mm film, shows an aviation day in a field, with an aeroplane surrounded by spectators and a truck with the word ‘Shell’ parked next to it.

results.title: [John Robertson Duigan Film Collection: Reel 12]
results.brief_description:
The John Robertson Duigan Collection is a collection of silent 9.5mm home movies filmed by early aviator and engineer John Robertson Duigan (1882–1951). The collection includes a Pathé-Baby 9.5mm film camera and projector owned by Duigan. The home movies provide an insight into the everyday lives of John and his family in Victoria, including picnics, trips to the Grampians and Colac, family snapshots and aeroplanes of the late 1920s.

This short film, originally shot on 9.5mm film, features a group of people shaking hands, waving and blowing kisses to the camera, followed by a woman and dog in a garden, and possibly Duigan posing with their dog.

results.title: [John Robertson Duigan Film Collection: Reel 11]
results.brief_description:
The John Robertson Duigan Collection is a collection of silent 9.5mm home movies filmed by early aviator and engineer John Robertson Duigan (1882–1951). The collection includes a Pathé-Baby 9.5mm film camera and projector owned by Duigan. The home movies provide an insight into the everyday lives of John and his family in Victoria, including picnics, trips to the Grampians and Colac, family snapshots and aeroplanes of the late 1920s.

This short film, originally shot on 9.5mm film, shows a series of images of people in 1920s dress, in the gardens of a property, and playing with a dog.

results.title: [John Robertson Duigan Film Collection: Reel 10]
results.brief_description:
The John Robertson Duigan Collection is a collection of silent 9.5mm home movies filmed by early aviator and engineer John Robertson Duigan (1882–1951). The collection includes a Pathé-Baby 9.5mm film camera and projector owned by Duigan. The home movies provide an insight into the everyday lives of John and his family in Victoria, including picnics, trips to the Grampians and Colac, family snapshots and aeroplanes of the late 1920s.

This short film, originally shot on 9.5mm film, features a small aircraft taking off in a field with people watching, followed by shots of a family picnic.
